div.h1: Find your place at ICS – Enroll Now!
div.p: Irvington Community Schools is accepting enrollment applications for a limited number of seats at Irvington Community Elementary School and Irvington Community Middle School, and for all grades at Irvington Preparatory Academy.
One of Indiana’s first public charter schools and consistently among the highest performing schools in Indianapolis.

div.h1: It takes a village to raise children to reach their potential.
div.p: Which is why Irvington Community Schools focus on community. We build key relationships between students and teachers, staff and families, and our schools and neighborhoods.

div.div: Check out our student-created video storytelling about Irvington Community Schools Watch Now

article.class: clearfix post-10 page type-page status-publish hentry
article.h1: Irvington Community Schools—Paving the Irvington Way since 2002
article.p: It takes a village to raise children to reach their potential. Which is why Irvington Community Schools (ICS) focuses on community. We build key relationships between students and teachers, staff and families, and our schools and neighborhoods.

Because every year is crucial to the ultimate outcome of a child’s education, ICS employs highly qualified teachers committed to the pursuit of academic excellence. All students participate in Art, Music, and Physical Education – which are at the heart of our charter with the Indianapolis Mayor’s Office of Education Innovation. We teach our students The Irvington Way: to be Respectful, Responsible, Safe, Involved, and Focused. The goal is to turn out thoughtful, civic-minded, successful adults.

We get academic results. The ILEARN results for 2018-2019 showed ICS grades 3-8 ranked in the top 25% of the Indianapolis Mayor’s Office of Education Innovation’s portfolio of public charter schools in both English Language Arts (ELA) and Math. What’s more, ICS outperformed eight out of 11 Marion County public school districts in ELA and seven out of 11 in Math, including Warren and Lawrence townships, as well as Indianapolis Public Schools (IPS).
Our 1:1 computing initiative (grades 3-12; 5:1 K-2) is a gateway for career readiness and college prep.
We emphasize safe schools: ICS created the first School Resource Officer program in Indiana public charters schools in 2011. When children feel safe, they learn best.

Public school education is all about developing children’s character, sense of community, and love of learning. Come see how we get things done at Irvington Community Schools – tuition-free K-12 education at its finest. To learn more about Irvington Community Schools, contact our school leaders: Deanna Pryor (Irvington Community Elementary School, grades K-5), Loryn Venekamp (Irvington Community Middle School, grades 6-8), or Jana Goebel (Irvington Preparatory Academy, grades 9-12).

p.strong: Irvington Community School, Inc. is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization.

a.title: Somebody’s Getting Old Around Here: IPA Alumni Enroll Children in ICES

div.a: Somebody’s Getting Old Around Here: IPA Alumni Enroll Children in ICES

div.h6:
Tours Every Tuesday from 1-2:30 p.m.
and By Request

div.p: ICS is unique as an Indianapolis-area K-12 public charter school in many ways. ICS Inc.'s three schools are each, by design, small community schools.

a.span: Why should any high school student not attending I

img.alt: Why should any high school student not attending IPA consider doing so? We won’t let you fall through the cracks. If you want to succeed, we will help you, no matter what. If you’re behind, if you need extra help, if you need more one-on-one time, or if you just need somebody to text your mom once a week and let her know whether or not you have missing work, this is the school for you!

a.span: I had already been working at ICS for a few years

img.alt: I had already been working at ICS for a few years when it was time to enroll my oldest son in Kindergarten. I knew that the teachers here were topnotch and that my children would receive a well-rounded education, including Physical Education and cultures classes. https://www.ics-charter.org/at-irvington-community-schools-education-really-is-a-family-affair-part-2/

a.span: WHEN STUDENTS FEEL SAFE, THEY LEARN BEST. Irvingto

img.alt: WHEN STUDENTS FEEL SAFE, THEY LEARN BEST. Irvington Community Schools established the first public charter School Resource Officer program in Indiana in 2011. Officer Bob Bowser, who came to ICS after a career with the Lawrence Police Department, retiring as LPD’s assistant police chief, believes in building strong relationships with students. He works with our team of deans and with our teachers and staff members who are trained in Restorative Justice and Positive Behavior Intervention Supports. Safety is one of the five tenets of The Irvington Way: Be Respectful, Responsible, Safe, Involved, and Focused. Regarding our student’s use of Chromebooks (1:1 grades 3-12; 5:1 K-2), we monitor all student communications on Google Apps and immediately respond to any potentially serious issues. We work hard to take care of any issues before they become an incident. Each morning, we greet students at the door to check in on them and get them squared away for a successful day of learning. Because we are much smaller than local public school districts, we get to know all of our students. Our 7-member School Safety Committee meets monthly to discuss the gamut of safety matters, working in a spirit of continuous improvement. Committee members have 127 years of collective experience in the field of public safety, including military, police, and emergency management. There are 11 Indiana School Safety Specialists on staff at ICS, certified by the Indiana Department of Education. Finally, ICS has received 6 consecutive Indiana Department of Homeland Security Secured Schools Safety Grants, as well as an Indiana Criminal Justice Institute safety grant, totaling nearly $250,000. All three schools’ main entrances received a safety “facelift” this summer to further limit access to our school buildings to protect our students and staff. WE TAKE SCHOOL SAFETY SERIOUSLY. Because you entrust your children to our care. It’s The Irvington Way.

div.p: At the heart of our schools is a strong community/neighborhood focus. Our Board of Governors helps to provide guidance on the direction of Irvington Community Schools and its service to the area in educating young people.

div.h6: IRVINGTON COMMUNITY ELEMENTARY SCHOOL GRADES K - 5
